audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a beeping sound, fluctuating in frequency, followed by a male voice noting the number is "in the lower 20s", specifically "between 19 and 22".  The scraping sound suggests the digging sound, soon followed by a high-pitched beeping sound. The male speaker then identifies "an Indian head", specifying that they will "get a date off of it later".

The audio begins with a male speaker stating, "Just got that one on an 18 signal." The speaker then observes, "Looks like it's going to be a ham wait." Following up, the speaker confirms, "Yep, that's what it is." The speaker mentions having it with their shovel. Throughout the clip, there is audible background noise.

The audio begins with a male speaker discussing his metal detecting finds, noting a lack of targets recently, but his success in finding a "wheat penny at about four or five inches deep". His tone is casual and conversational as he explains, "That's about it". Subsequently, the distinct metallic sound of a metal detector being used cuts in, suggesting it's still actively scanning the ground.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing readings of "28, 29," depth, and a "silver dime," followed by a sound like a beep. The speaker is calm as he talks about holding the phone and doing "a live dig." Digging sounds begin, with the sound of dirt being moved. The audio concludes with the sound of metal being detected.

The audio clip begins with one male speaker noting "it is a silver," then he further speculates, "it's going to be a mercury dime." He suggests trying to focus on the dime for a potential date, stating if not, they'll "get one off of it later." Following this, he states that he "just got that one on a 22 silver." The ambient background noise remains relatively consistent throughout.

A metallic, ringing sound is heard, followed by a male speaker noting it sounds like a copper penny and describing it as having an eagle on one side and stating "no cash value" on the other, leading him to believe it's a token. He suggests cleaning it up for a better look. Scraping sounds are then heard. The speaker is heard again, suggesting the listener hear a sound before digging, as an electronic beeping or chirping sound is heard. The speaker describes the numeric values bouncing and depth indicators. Following this, an outdoor digging sound can be heard. The speaker announces the find is an Indian Head penny, possibly dated 1907, and notes its depth. A high-pitched ringing sound is then audible, followed by the speaker stating he is just eyeballing a gold earring lying on top of the ground.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker assessing the material of an object, stating that "it's just plated," clarifying "too light to be anything but plated". He then mentions a "jumpy signal in the mid 30s." An electronic, beeping sound is then heard, accompanied by the speaker's comment that "it's bouncing around a little bit," before stating that most of the clean signals are gone.

The audio begins with a man speaking, he plans to dig something up and examine it, revealing he has found a "religious coin or token" about six inches deep. He promises to share a picture of it. Subsequently, another discovery is announced with a "loud 26 signal". The man describes finding something that looks like "some kind of figure or something," promising to clean it for a better view. Finally, the recording ends with a sound of wind noise.

The clip begins with one male speaker describing receiving a "26-27 signal". He continues describing digging out a metal object from about six inches below the surface. He initially thought it was a drawer pull, but notes that there are no attachment points, and it feels heavy, like it's made of lead. The scene continues with the same man describing another signal that reads "30-31" but notes that it could just be a clad quarter. There are metal detecting sounds, alongside a low hum.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker who says, "Hey, looks like we got a silver ring," followed by an affirmation of its probable silver composition, noting that it has "some weight to it." He mentions he can't see a mark, and he needs to clean it to check for a possible maker's mark. He is 99% positive it is silver. The clip then transitions to an upbeat country tune played on a guitar, with a positive and cheerful mood.
